snippet: The cabin cruiser that capsized off Long Island on the Fourth of July, killing three children, was not necessarily overloaded, even though it was carrying 27 people, a lawyer for its owner said Friday.
abstract: Attorney for Kevin M Treanor, the owner of cabin cruiser that capsized off Long Island on the Fourth of July, killing three children, says that it was not necessarily overloaded, even though it was carrying 27 people.
lead_paragraph: The cabin cruiser that capsized off Long Island on the Fourth of July, killing three children, was not necessarily overloaded, even though it was carrying 27 people, a lawyer for its owner said Friday.

headline.seo: Capsized Boat May Not Have Been Overcrowded, Owner’s Lawyer Says
headline.main: Boat in Fatal Accident May Not Have Been Overloaded, Owner’s Lawyer Says
headline.print_headline: Boat in Fatal Accident May Not Have Been Overloaded, Owner’s Lawyer Says
